items.title: PostalAddress
items.description: A physical address.

postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

addressCountry.description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

addressSubdivision.description: the subdivision or neighborhood (us real estate extension)

contactPoint.description: contact points for the person

items.title: ContactPoint
items.description:
A point of contact for the entity. By convention in the real estate domain, ContactPoints
are preferred over telephone, email, and faxNumber so the ContactPoint.name property can be used to label values
for example, Work Telephone, Home, as named contactPoint values.

name.description: a label for the contactPoint, i.e. 'Work', or 'Home'

email.description: an email address for the item.

additionalName.title: additionalName
additionalName.description: any other name(s) associated with the entity, i.e. nickname, middle name, maiden name, etc. For multiple names, use a comma without space as a separator.
examples: Prince,The Artist Formerly Known as Prince,The Artist

faxNumber.description: Do people still use fax machines?

honorificPrefix.title: honorificPrefix
honorificPrefix.description: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

honorificSuffix.title: honorificSuffix
honorificSuffix.description: An honorific title following a person's name like M.D.

jobTitle.title: jobTitle
jobTitle.description: job tiles associated with the item

_json.description:
A message is published to this topic when a listing is created, updated, or deleted.
The message payload is a JSON-LD object with the following properties:
- `type` - the type of message, one of `CreateAction`, `UpdateAction`, or `DeleteAction`
- `object` - the listing, as a JSON-LD object

oneOf.title: profile.update
oneOf.summary: an agent, office or organization profile was updated

time.description: date & time the event was produced

agent.summary: the event provider who sent the event via a subscription authorized to your service.
agent.description:
if you are a multi-tenant app, then the agent is the user associated with the event data.
any future events related to this message will be sent to the same agent/recipient

instrument.description: the app or service that produced the event on behalf of the agent/user

source.description: a copy of the event was sent to the source(s).

originalRecipient.summary: the original recipient of the event
originalRecipient.description:
the originalRecipient helps you determine the subscription that delivered the event to you.
if the originalRecipient is the same as the agent, then the you are subscribed to the agent.
if the originalRecipient is different from the agent, then you are subscribed to the event source

id.summary: the event id - the cannonical identifier for the event
id.description:
the Event ID (aka "Publish ID") is the immutable canonical identifier for the event.
it is a URI that is unique to the event and will not change.
all subscribers will receive the same id for the same event.

@id.summary: the @id is the url in your inbox where you can retrieve the event

time.description: date & time the event was produced

agent.summary: the event provider who sent the event via a subscription authorized to your service.
agent.description:
if you are a multi-tenant app, then the agent is the user associated with the event data.
any future events related to this message will be sent to the same agent/recipient

instrument.description: the app or service that produced the event on behalf of the agent/user

source.description: a copy of the event was sent to the source(s).

originalRecipient.summary: the original recipient of the event
originalRecipient.description:
the originalRecipient helps you determine the subscription that delivered the event to you.
if the originalRecipient is the same as the agent, then the you are subscribed to the agent.
if the originalRecipient is different from the agent, then you are subscribed to the event source

id.summary: the event id - the cannonical identifier for the event
id.description:
the Event ID (aka "Publish ID") is the immutable canonical identifier for the event.
it is a URI that is unique to the event and will not change.
all subscribers will receive the same id for the same event.

@id.summary: the @id is the url in your inbox where you can retrieve the event

A point of contact for the entity. By convention in the real estate domain, ContactPoints
are preferred over telephone, email, and faxNumber so the ContactPoint.name property can be used to label values
for example, Work Telephone, Home, as named contactPoint values.

name.description: a label for the contactPoint, i.e. 'Work', or 'Home'

email.description: an email address for the item.

additionalProperties.description: additional properties for the website user

instrument.description: the site, app or service being on which the user action was observed.

oneOf.name: realestate/website#requestappointment
oneOf.summary: website user has requested an appointment

time.description: date & time the event was produced

agent.summary: the event provider who sent the event via a subscription authorized to your service.
agent.description:
if you are a multi-tenant app, then the agent is the user associated with the event data.
any future events related to this message will be sent to the same agent/recipient

instrument.description: the app or service that produced the event on behalf of the agent/user

source.description: a copy of the event was sent to the source(s).

originalRecipient.summary: the original recipient of the event
originalRecipient.description:
the originalRecipient helps you determine the subscription that delivered the event to you.
if the originalRecipient is the same as the agent, then the you are subscribed to the agent.
if the originalRecipient is different from the agent, then you are subscribed to the event source

id.summary: the event id - the cannonical identifier for the event
id.description:
the Event ID (aka "Publish ID") is the immutable canonical identifier for the event.
it is a URI that is unique to the event and will not change.
all subscribers will receive the same id for the same event.

@id.summary: the @id is the url in your inbox where you can retrieve the event

identifier.description: identifier assigned to a contact by the vendor who originally created the contact

sameAs.description: vendor specific identifier for the user can be shared with other vendors to identify the user

For cases such as shares of real property, units, and other more granular cases, please utilize the UniversalPropertySubId.
